poem:
**Flux in the City**

In New York's thrumming heart,  
two souls fleeing shadows  
of broken chords and tangled names.  
Here, in the city's uncertain hum,  
John and Yoko drift, adrift;  
searching for silence in chaos,  
shelter in each other's wounds.  
Past and future blur,  
yet love, like grace, persists,  
uninvited, unwavering, whole.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Did John and Yoko split because of Richard Nixon? The making of revelatory music film One to One People are usually at their most interesting when they are in flux – uncertain of the way forward, of what life they ought to build. That was the case with John Lennon and Yoko Ono when they arrived in New York in 1971. They were both fleeing England – the recriminations around the Beatles breakup; the terrible". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
